list.title: ANC (Absolute Neutrophil Count)
list.desc: The Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) is frequently used to assess neutropenic fever in chemotherapy patients.

list.title: APGAR Score
list.desc: The APGAR Score assesses neonates vitality at 1 and 5 minutes after birth.

list.title: Basal Energy Expenditure
list.desc: The Basal Energy Expenditure calculates daily energy expenditure.

list.title: Bicarbonate Deficit
list.desc: The Bicarbonate Deficit calculator calculates the total body bicarbonate deficit.

list.title: Body Mass Index (BMI) and Body Surface Area (BSA)
list.desc: The BMI and BSA calculators estimate the Body Mass Index and Body Surface Area.

list.title: Calcium Correction for Hypoalbuminemia
list.desc: The Calcium Correction for Hypoalbuminemia calculates a corrected calcium level for patients with hypoalbuminemia.

list.title: PSI/PORT Score: Pneumonia Severity Index for CAP
list.desc: The PSI/PORT Score: Pneumonia Severity Index for Adult CAP estimates mortality for adult patients with community-acquired pneumonia.

list.title: Framingham Risk Score for Hard Coronary Heart Disease
list.desc: The Framingham Coronary Heart Disease Risk Score estimates risk of heart attack in 10 years.

list.title: CHADS2 Score for Atrial Fibrillation Stroke Risk
list.desc: The CHADS2 score estimates stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation.

list.title: Creatinine Clearance (Cockcroft-Gault Equation)
list.desc: The Creatinine Clearance (Cockcroft-Gault Equation) predicts Creatinine Clearance from serum Creatinine.

list.title: Corrected QT Interval (QTc)
list.desc: The Corrected QT Interval (QTc) adjusts the QT interval correctly for heart rate extremes.

list.title: Sodium Correction for Hyperglycemia
list.desc: The Sodium Correction for Hyperglycemia Calculates the actual sodium level in patients with hyperglycemia.

list.title: Maddrey's Discriminant Function for Alcoholic Hepatitis
list.desc: The Maddrey’s Discriminant Function suggests which patients with alcoholic hepatitis may have a poor prognosis and benefit from steroid administration.

list.title: Pediatric Endotracheal Tube (ETT) Size
list.desc: The Pediatric Endotracheal Tube (ETT) Size estimates ET tube size based on age.

list.title: Fractional Excretion of Sodium (FENa)
list.desc: The Fractional Excretion of Sodium (FENa) determines if renal failure is due to pre-renal, intrinsic, or post-renal pathology.

list.title: Fractional Excretion of Urea (FEUrea)
list.desc: The Fractional Excretion of Urea (FEUrea) determines the cause of renal failure. Similar to the FENa, but can be used on patients on diuretics.

list.title: Glasgow Coma Scale/Score (GCS)
list.desc: The Glasgow Coma Scale/Score (GCS) estimates coma severity based on Eye (4), Verbal (5), and Motor (6) criteria.

list.title: Ideal Body Weight and Adjusted Body Weight
list.desc: The Ideal Body Weight calculator calculates ideal body weight by the Devine formula.

list.title: LDL Calculated
list.desc: The LDL Calculated calculates LDL based on total and HDL cholesterol and triglycerides.

list.title: Maintenance Fluids Calculations
list.desc: The Maintenance Fluids Calculator calculates maintenance fluid requirements by weight.

list.title: Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
list.desc: The Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) calculates mean arterial pressure from measured systolic and diastolic blood pressure values.

list.title: MDRD GFR Equation
list.desc: The MDRD GFR Equation estimates glomerular filtration rate based on creatinine and patient characteristics.

list.title: MELD Na (UNOS/OPTN)
list.desc: The MELD Score (Model For End-Stage Liver Disease) (12 and older) quantifies end-stage liver disease for transplant planning.

list.title: Oxygenation Index
list.desc: The Oxygenation Index Predicts outcomes, especially in pediatric patients by helping to determine need for ECMO.

list.title: Parkland Formula for Burns
list.desc: Calculates fluid requirements for burn patients in a 24-hour period.

list.title: Pediatric Ins and Outs
list.desc: The Pediatric Ins and Outs (per kg and per hour) calculates fluid status in volume per weight & volume per weight per time, for pediatrics.

list.title: PELD Score (Pediatric End-Stage Liver Disease) (younger than 12)
list.desc: The PELD Score (Pediatric End-Stage Liver Disease) calculates the pediatric version of the MELD score for liver cirrhosis severity and transplant planning

list.title: Ranson's Criteria for Pancreatitis Mortality
list.desc: The Ranson's Criteria for Pancreatitis Mortality Estimates mortality of patients with pancreatitis, based on initial and 48-hour lab values.

list.title: Serum Osmolality/Osmolarity
list.desc: The Serum Osmolality/Osmolarity calculates expected serum osmolarity, for comparison to measured osmolarity to detect unmeasured compounds in the serum.

list.title: San Francisco Syncope Rule
list.desc: The San Francisco Syncope Rule predicts risk for serious outcomes at 7 days in patients presenting with syncope or near-syncope.

list.title: Sodium Deficit in Hyponatremia
list.desc: The Sodium Deficit in Hyponatremia Calculates sodium quantity missing in hyponatremia.

list.title: TIMI Risk Score for STEMI
list.desc: The TIMI Risk Score for STEMI estimates 30-day mortality in patients with STEMI.

list.title: Osmolar/Osmotic Gap
list.desc: The Stool Osmolar/Osmotic Gap determines if chronic diarrhea is osmotic or secretory in nature.

list.title: Centor Score (Modified/McIsaac) for Strep Pharyngitis
list.desc: The Centor Score (Modified) for Strep Pharyngitis Estimates probability that pharyngitis is streptococcal, and suggests management course.

list.title: TIMI Risk Score for UA/NSTEMI
list.desc: The TIMI Risk Score for UA/NSTEMI estimates mortality for patients with unstable angina and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (MI).

list.title: Free Water Deficit in Hypernatremia
list.desc: The Free Water Deficit in Hypernatremia calculates free water deficit by estimated total body water.

list.title: Wells' Criteria for Pulmonary Embolism
list.desc: The Wells’ Criteria for Pulmonary Embolism objectifies risk of pulmonary embolism (PE).

list.title: Winters' Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation
list.desc: The Winters’ Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation Calculates the expected pCO2 compensation in a purely metabolic acidosis

list.title: A-a O2 Gradient
list.desc: The A-a O2 Gradient assesses for degree of shunting and V/Q mismatch.

list.title: ASAS Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis (SpA)
list.desc: The ASAS Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis (SpA) diagnoses axial spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.

list.title: CURB-65 Score for Pneumonia Severity
list.desc: The CURB-65 Severity Score estimates mortality of community-acquired pneumonia to help determine inpatient vs. outpatient treatment.

list.title: Phenytoin (Dilantin) Correction for Albumin/Renal Failure
list.desc: The Phenytoin (Dilantin) Correction for Albumin / Renal Failure corrects serum phenytoin level for renal failure and/or hypoalbuminemia.

list.title: Child-Pugh Score for Cirrhosis Mortality
list.desc: The Child-Pugh Score for Cirrhosis Mortality estimates cirrhosis severity.

list.title: PERC Rule for Pulmonary Embolism
list.desc: The PERC Rule for Pulmonary Embolism Rules out PE if no criteria are present and pre-test probability is ≤15%.

list.title: ABCD2 Score for TIA
list.desc: The ABCD2 Score for TIA estimates risk of stroke (CVA) after a transient ischemic attack (TIA), according to patient risk factors.

list.title: Wells' Criteria for DVT
list.desc: The Wells’ Criteria for DVT Objectifies risk of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) based on clinical findings.

list.title: Ottawa Knee Rule
list.desc: The Ottawa Knee Rule describes criteria for minor knee trauma patients that are so low risk as not to warrant knee imaging.

list.title: Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) Score
list.desc: The Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) Score estimates mortality based on age and CT findings.

list.title: Hunt & Hess Classification of Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
list.desc: The Hunt & Hess Classification of Subarachnoid Hemorrhage Classifies severity of subarachnoid hemorrhage to predict mortality.

list.title: Pregnancy Due Dates Calculator
list.desc: The Pregnancy Due Dates Calculator Calculates pregnancy dates, forward from last period or backward from due date.

list.title: Sodium Correction Rate in Hyponatremia and Hypernatremia
list.desc: The Sodium Correction Rate for Hyponatremia Calculates recommended fluid type, rate and volume to correct hyponatremia slowly (or more rapidly if seizing).

list.title: Glasgow-Blatchford Bleeding Score (GBS)
list.desc: The Glasgow-Blatchford Bleeding Score (GBS) stratifies upper GI bleeding patients who are 'low-risk' and candidates for outpatient management.

list.title: King's College Criteria for Acetaminophen Toxicity
list.desc: The Kings College Criteria for Acetaminophen Overdose evaluates the need for translpantation in liver failure secondary to acetaminophen overdose.

list.title: Mangled Extremity Severity Score (MESS)
list.desc: The Mangled Extremity Severity Score (MESS) estimates viability of an extremity after trauma to determine need for salvage versus empiric amputation.

list.title: Acetaminophen Overdose and NAC Dosing
list.desc: The Acetaminophen Overdose and NAC dosing Calculates PO or IV dosing of N-acetylcysteine (NAC) for acetaminophen overdose.

list.title: PECARN Pediatric Head Injury/Trauma Algorithm
list.desc: The PECARN Pediatric Head Injury/Trauma Algorithm provides the PECARN algorithm for evaluating pediatric head injury.

list.title: New Orleans/Charity Head Trauma/Injury Rule
list.desc: The New Orleans/Charity Head Trauma/Injury Rule Offers criteria for which patients are unlikely to require imaging after head trauma.

list.title: Canadian CT Head Injury/Trauma Rule
list.desc: The Canadian CT Head Injury/Trauma Rule clears head injury without imaging.

list.title: Alvarado Score for Acute Appendicitis
list.desc: The Alvarado Score for Acute Appendicitis predicts likelihood of appendicitis diagnosis.

list.title: TIMI Risk Index
list.desc: The TIMI Risk Index provides mortality estimate in patients with ACS using only blood pressure, heart rate, and age.

list.title: Hepatic Encephalopathy Grades/Stages
list.desc: The Hepatic Encephalopathy Grades/Stages defines criteria for the stages of hepatic encephalopathy based on west Haven Criteria
